image.altText: Composite of heatwave map and workers from Queensland Fire and Emergency Services

props.synopsis: A burst of hot northerly winds will bring the highest temperatures in years to parts of south-east Australia, while ex-Tropical Cyclone Kirrily carves a trail of torrential rain and flooding.

title.children: From heatwave to ex-Cyclone Kirrily flooding: What Australia can expect in coming days

image.altText: Premier Chris Minns in a blazer and blue tie

props.synopsis: The NSW premier could be in for a bruising year, but he's not shying away from a fight, writes state political reporter Nick Dole.

title.children: Focus on fixing the state, not Gaza: Premier Chris Minns reads riot act to MPs

image.altText: Soccer players wearing yellow and green sit in the grass while a player in red walks away after a game

props.synopsis: They were minutes away from a heroic win in Qatar, but a South Korean comeback saw Australia tumble out of the Asian Cup at the quarterfinal stage after crashing to a 2-1 defeat, with midfielder Aiden O'Neill shown a straight red card in extra time.

title.children: Socceroos lose to South Korea in extra time of quarterfinal to be eliminated from Asian Cup

image.altText: Carl Weathers

props.synopsis: Carl Weathers, who played Apollo Creed in the Rocky movies and starred alongside Arnold Schwarzenegger in Predator, has died aged 76.

title.children: Rocky and Predator actor Carl Weathers dies aged 76

image.altText: legal representatives

props.synopsis: This criminal case is at the heart of an unfolding crisis few Australians are aware of. This week there was an important breakthrough, writes Bridget Brennan.

title.children: After 11 years this family is closer to learning what happened to their loved one. Many others will never get answers

image.altText: Illustration of three people, a woman and two men

props.synopsis: Australian scientists have made countless groundbreaking discoveries. The Science Show's Robyn Williams has selected a 'Top 100' and he wants to know what you think.

title.children: Australia's scientists are at the top of their game. Here are some that are changing our world

image.altText: A young woman walks outside a building wearing a grey jacket.

props.synopsis: A London judge clears Greta Thunberg of a public order offence, ruling that the police had no power to arrest her and other climate activists.

title.children: ­­Climate activist Greta Thunberg cleared of public order offence

image.altText: Two men and a woman in suits stand behind podiums in front of a doorway into Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Regardless of whether Australia's economic picture is improving or heading for a crash, it's unlikely voters will have stage 3 tax cuts front of mind come the next general election, writes Melissa Clarke.

title.children: Australia's changing economy could undermine Albanese's big gamble

image.altText: Luay Sako leaves a prison van, dressed in grey clothing.

props.synopsis: More than three years on, the family of Celeste Manno remain in disbelief that she was murdered by an intruder wielding a knife and a hammer in the middle of the night.

title.children: In a Melbourne court, the horror of 'bogeyman' killer Luay Sako's crime was laid bare

image.altText: The front of a march where a banner reads 'honour the treaty'

props.synopsis: This weekend, 80,000 people are expected to arrive at the grounds where New Zealand's founding document was signed by Māori chiefs and representatives of the crown. And they have a message for the prime minister.

title.children: Tears, mud-slinging and a sex toy stunt: Why NZ's PM might be nervous about next week

image.altText: A composite of two images: One of US President Joe Biden speaking in a suit and tie. The other of Donald Trump smiling in a suit

props.synopsis: The race for the Democratic presidential nomination begins this weekend in South Carolina but Joe Biden's chances of securing a second term in the White House aren't so certain, as young voters turn away.

title.children: Angry and disillusioned: The young voters who could cost Joe Biden a second term

image.altText: Vince McMahon in a suit and tie holding a microphone inside a wrestling ring with the WWE logo behind him

props.synopsis: Recent allegations of sexual abuse by the former owner of the WWE are just the latest in a decades-long history of misconduct claims.

title.children: He ruled professional wrestling for decades. Now Vince McMahon grapples with fresh sexual abuse allegations

image.altText: housing estate shot from a drone

props.synopsis: It seems there's no stopping the march forward in the Australian property market, with housing prices expected to continue to rise by about 6 per cent in capital cities through 2024.

title.children: Millions of home owners made $3,000 in January but probably didn’t notice

image.altText: Snowtown accomplice Mark Ray Haydon.

props.synopsis: As a journalist who covered the shocking murders, it is hard to fathom how one of the men who helped give Adelaide the moniker 'the murder capital of Australia' can be allowed out of jail, writes James Wakelin.

title.children: How can a Snowtown 'bodies-in-the-barrels' perpetrator be freed from jail?

image.altText: Vin Chinnien with a piercing in his ear, wearing a black button shirt

props.synopsis: Police said Aroulen Chinnien, who was in his 20s, and woman in her 30s died after being hit by the train at Berowra Railway Station about midnight.

title.children: Woman jumped onto rail tracks to retrieve item thrown by man before pair killed by freight train

image.altText: A row of bins outside a house.

props.synopsis: A Sydney council has backed down from a plan to switch from weekly to fortnightly waste collection after complaints about smelly bins, maggots and flies.

title.children: Sydney council changes direction on bin pickups after FOGO rollout sparks complaints

image.altText: of one of the "inhabited bridges" in Bhutan's proposed mindfulness city featuring a robot and a traditional artisan.

props.synopsis: Bhutan's king has announced ambitious plans to develop a "mindfulness city" in a bid to boost the country's economy and reverse an exodus of young and qualified people seeking opportunities abroad — mainly in Australia.

title.children: Can Bhutan's plans for a 'mindfulness city' convince its diaspora community to come home?

image.altText: A large crowd gathered outside the Opera House

props.synopsis: NSW Police say forensic analysis finds no evidence the phrase "gas the Jews" was chanted in videos circulating online from a pro-Palestinian rally in October, despite people providing statements the phrase was used.

title.children: Video analysis finds no evidence 'gas the Jews' chant used at Opera House rally, police say

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese speaks to the press club in a stern, close-up shot

props.synopsis: Following the tax debate requires wading through a dense thicket of brackets, creeps, rates, thresholds, highs, middles and lows. Confused? You're entitled to be.

title.children: Still confused by the great tax debate? Here's the substance minus the spin

image.altText: sign with red cross over transmission lines and towers on farm gate fence

props.synopsis: Poor engagement and consultation has led to "material distrust" of renewable energy developers in regional communities, according to a much-anticipated review.

title.children: 'Distrust, uncertainty and anxiety' in regional communities over green energy transition, report reveals

image.altText: Black and white footage at sea that appears to show an explosion in the distance.

props.synopsis: Ukraine claims it has used sea drones to sink a small Russian warship in the Black Sea as Russian investigators allege its military transport plane was brought down by missiles fired by Kyiv's forces.

title.children: Ukraine claims its sea drones sank a Russian warship, Moscow says Patriot missiles downed its plane

image.altText: Australian fast bowler Xavier Bartlett grins as he runs toward a teammate with palms out for a high five after a wicket.

props.synopsis: One-day world champions Australia earn a comfortable win in the first game of a three-match series against West Indies in Melbourne, with debutant Xavier Bartlett continuing his brilliant white-ball form.

title.children: Sparkling debut for Bartlett as Australia beats West Indies in first ODI

image.altText: Two pics of a man in army uniform.

props.synopsis: Teen finds World War I photos of soldiers and army platoons and family photos from the early 1900's,in an esky floating in floodwaters less than 100 metres away from being washed out to sea.

title.children: Search for owners after teen finds esky full of black and white photos in floodwaters

image.altText: Man in a navy suit with a light blue tie.

props.synopsis: The former chief of staff to former Liberal MP Craig Kelly has been found guilty of indecently assaulting four of his former female employees.

title.children: 'It's been a long time coming,' says complainant as Frank Zumbo found guilty of indecently assaulting four female staff

image.altText: A huge ball of flame erupts into the night sky behind two small blocks of units and a small carpark.

props.synopsis: A vehicle loaded with gas explodes, setting off an inferno which burned homes and warehouses in Kenya's capital Nairobi.

title.children: Gas explosion and fire kill at least three, injure over 270 in Kenya's capital

image.altText: A mugshot of a teenage girl next to a mugshot of a teenage boy.

props.synopsis: A judge reveals the identities of Scarlett Jenkinson and Eddie Ratcliffe, as they wait to hear their prison sentences.

title.children: British teenagers who killed transgender teen Brianna Ghey named ahead of sentencing

image.altText: Woman with brown hair sits in front of a car

props.synopsis: Planning experts say more investment is needed in public transport to support high density housing, as Greater Sydney's population is estimated to sit at 6 million by 2040.

title.children: Isabelle's commute became a 'hot mess' overnight. What solutions are there to Sydney's traffic woes?

image.altText: Australians are due to receive a tax cut from July.

props.synopsis: Which neighbourhoods, occupations and age groups are more likely to benefit or miss out from the redesign of the stage 3 tax cuts? We've delved into the data to find out how different parts of Australia compare.

title.children: Nurse, teacher, surgeon — is your job likely to win from the revised tax cuts?

image.altText: A wanted posted in Japan

props.synopsis: It's relatively easy to disappear in Japan — so much so, there's even a name for the thousands of people who deliberately go missing each year: the Johatsu. The country's most wanted terrorist may have been one of them.

title.children: Japan's most-wanted man had a perfect cover to elude capture. But when he was drunk, he gave away a clue

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses walks surrounded by people.

props.synopsis: The operator of a jumping castle that killed six children after being lifted into the air pleads not guilty to a related safety charge in a northern Tasmanian court.

title.children: Profanity hurled at Hillcrest jumping castle operator after she pleads not guilty

image.altText: An old colour photo of a young man wearing a black singlet and smiling

props.synopsis: The NT coroner says she is "not at all persuaded" by NT Police's theory for the death of Shane Tapp in 2021, in handing down the findings of an inquest into his death.

title.children: NT coroner rejects police theory Katherine man Shane Tapp died by 'accidental drowning'

image.altText: An elderly man in a check shirt sitting in front of a balloon display.

props.synopsis: He's lived through two world wars, the Great Depression and at least two global pandemics but Perth retiree Gordon Ewers says he's nothing but grateful for his life.

title.children: Australian man celebrates 108 years of living a life of love and kindness

image.altText: Cahills Crossing viewing platform

props.synopsis: A dry season phenomenon draws both locals and tourists to the notorious Cahills Crossing in the Northern Territory. But a ranger says some people are ignoring warnings about the risk of crocodile attacks.

title.children: Humans and crocodiles don't get any closer than at this notorious outback crossing

image.altText: The inside of a movie theatre with red velvet seats, a yellow, orange, blue pattern carpet going down the steps.

props.synopsis: Majestic Cinemas says a slump in film releases has forced it to enter voluntary administration this week despite record-grossing films last year.

title.children: 'Barbenheimer' not enough to save regional theatre chain from voluntary administration

image.altText: Photos of a dozen fossiled footprints in brown sandy, rock

props.synopsis: Scientists believe footprints that were accidentally found on a Moroccan beach were made by five modern humans 90,000 years ago.

title.children: Scientists race against tides to discover why 90,000-year-old footprints were made
